content: Hello @WG-async-foundations! It's time for our weekly triage meeting
Go ahead and react with a :wave: to show you're here

Our agenda this week:

  • Announcements and introductions
  • New issue triage
  • Discussion on progress/blockers around sprint bugs
Let's start off with announcements and introductions
Niko and I have been working on an async fn in dyn traits explainer that is now live

tmandry said:

Niko and I have been working on an async fn in dyn traits explainer that is now live

Yay! I'm planning to read over that today.
This week is the sprint planning meeting, so I'll remind everyone to check the planning doc beforehand.
Planning doc: https://hackmd.io/gPgXC4fsTZOgOnd-Bwhoag
This sprint seems like it's going by very fast

I've got a fun one: I've started working towards a proposal to stabilize the IntoFuture trait for 1.61. The last bit of polish for it was merged a few days ago, and I'm now working on validating the feature actually works as expected in the Azure SDK. Once that passes I think we should have enough to confidently recommend stabilization!
Also, most people are probably aware, but we've started using this time slot every other week to do a new async reading group!
It looks like next week we'll be talking about @Yoshua Wuyts [he/they]'s post on async overloading
For details see this HackMD
I don't see any new people here today, so we probably don't have any introductions. If I missed someone though, feel free to say hi.

At that should do it for announcements and introductions.
@triagebot end-topic

Does anyone have something to add on the current topic?
React with :working_on_it: if you have something to say.
React with :all_good: if not.
Next up is new issue triage
We have one new issue, although I'm a little surprised it's not marked as triaged
generator_interior should be refactored to use ExprUseVisitor #94463

This is an issue I filed after @nikomatsakis and I were working some more on generator captures. We think it should be possible to clean up and simplify the generator_interior typeck code by relying on ExprUseVisitor only.
sounds kind of fun :)
We should wait until after drop tracking gets turned on though (which is getting close!)
I think there's one more PR for drop tracking that's needed, and then we can do another crater run and hopefully turn it on by default.
so if I understand correctly, drop tracking, when turned on, replaces part of the job of the interior analysis, but not all of it?
I might be misremembering something

tmandry said:

so if I understand correctly, drop tracking, when turned on, replaces part of the job of the interior analysis, but not all of it?

I'd say it supplements it. All the previous code is still there and still runs, but now in the call to record we check whether the value is known to be dropped at that point before recording it in the generator type
ah
so it's really a part of the interior analysis
makes sense

Drop tracking ends up having to do a lot of extra analysis to decide if something is dropped. It uses ExprUseVisitor to find the interesting things to track, then it builds a CFG, then iterates to a fixpoint

tmandry said:

so it's really a part of the interior analysis

Yes, exactly

Anyway, that's all I've got for triage.
@triagebot end-topic

Does anyone have something to add on the current topic?
React with :working_on_it: if you have something to say.
React with :all_good: if not.
Finally, we can use the remaining time to discuss any status/progress/blockers on the current sprint.
I need to do some reviews for polish fixes. Otherwise working on other sprint goals, I hope to have an RFC up for review sometime this week.
(Not for dyn.. for something related to RPITIT)
@nikomatsakis and I have a fix for #57017 pretty much ready to go. The PR is at #94309
Looking over the sprint planning doc, I realize I haven't spent any time working on back traces yet, so I should do that...
ah I guess that's the thing I need to review
I'm making progress, but I fear I will miss most of my sprint goals again. This two week sprint is looking like eight now :-(
Hopefully I'll get this next blog post up though
sorry for the delay. been digging out of a major backlog of notifications

tmandry said:

sorry for the delay. been digging out of a major backlog of notifications

no worries!

I did find an interesting thing - I had thought the only decent solution for Read with completion IO was using BufRead, but I think some kind of alternate trait with an owned buffer is also reasonable and seems to be preferred by current implementations. More in the blog post...
I've also been working on a blog post on different ways of looking at async cancellation. It will probably end up being two, but I hope to get that posted soon
It sounds like we're kind of quieting down.
We can probably go ahead and wrap up then
@triagebot end-meeting

Does anyone have something to bring up?
React with :working_on_it: if you have something to say.
React with :all_good: if you're ready to end the meeting.
Thanks, everyone!

eholk said:

I've also been working on a blog post on different ways of looking at async cancellation. It will probably end up being two, but I hope to get that posted soon

very excited to read this!
